channel.title: CVE Feed for Trellix -- Trellix Agent
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Trellix -- Trellix Agent

item.title: CVE-2023-0977|2024-08-02T05:32:45.969Z -- trellix -- trellix%20agent
item.description: A heap-based overflow vulnerability in Trellix Agent (Windows and Linux) version 5.7.8 and earlier, allows a remote user to alter the page heap in the macmnsvc process memory block resulting in the service becoming unavailable.

item.title: CVE-2023-1388|2024-08-02T05:49:11.337Z -- trellix -- trellix%20agent
item.description: A heap-based overflow vulnerability in TA prior to version 5.7.9 allows a remote user to alter the page heap in the macmnsvc process memory block, resulting in the service becoming unavailable.

item.title: CVE-2023-0975|2024-08-02T05:32:46.110Z -- trellix -- trellix%20agent
item.description: A vulnerability exists in Trellix Agent for Windows version 5.7.8 and earlier, that allows local users, during install/upgrade workflow, to replace one of the Agent’s executables before it can be executed. This allows the user to elevate their permissions.

item.title: CVE-2023-0976|2024-08-02T05:32:46.378Z -- trellix -- trellix%20agent
item.description: A command Injection Vulnerability in TA for mac-OS prior to version 5.7.9 allows local users to place an arbitrary file into the /Library/Trellix/Agent/bin/ folder. The malicious file is executed by running the TA deployment feature located in the System Tree.
